"There is no soul within the corporate machine"

Yup - I know this working firsthand at a popular pizza place I will not 
name. I think what's hilarious though is the amount of rules these 
corporations force upon their employee's, and how little they give a fuck 
about them. The funny thing is if you even have the balls to raise your 
opinion about anything the managers who get paid like 1-2$ above minimum 
wage will immediately shut you down just to further feel better about 
themselves and to try and justify their positions and get in the bed 
further with the owners who could give half a fuck about them in the first 
place. 

I know people who dedicate 50+ hours a week and are treated like absolute 
garbage by the managers/owners who will make sure to fuck them on overtime 
hours- but I think almost anybody who works fastfood or minimum wage jobs 
in general just comes to expect this - no fucks are given for laws either 
and lawyers are so fucking expensive that it isn't even worth the time . 

I know people who have worked 5 years who have been fired for arriving mere 
minutes late over things they had no control over, people who devote vasts 
amounts of time just to be bumped down a peg because the manager has some 
fetish for some hot girl and gives them management/more hours despite that 
person lacking seniority; people who walk in with skin conditions who cant 
shave deep who get fired because of "no facial" hair policys, or people who 
have to cover their piercings, scars or tattoo's with ridiculous bandaids. 
Not to mention places that give 17-19 year olds the power to fire people 
twice their age who have been their twice as long for piety reasons or just 
for a power trip. 

There is literally no room for error where I work, and no compassion or 
empathy when it comes to anything. Employment is no place for any forms of 
self expression or unique talent - but a place where you are expected to 
work as a drone pipe down and bend over to those in power. I've phoned my 
employer to let them know I had to be late 10 minutes over something I had 
no control over after taking shifts from those who've never showed up and 
staying late despite not having to and the managers I've worked with have 
ridiculed me for it saying "calling late" doesn't "help them" as if they 
could give a fuck about my reasons or my courtesy for even notifying them 
in the first place. Managers who literally look for any small reason to 
fire somebody over just to feel good about themselves. I know a 17 year old 
manager who bragged about firing somebody 3 years older - and these are the 
kinds of people these establishments cater to. 

Minimum wage jobs attract the shittiest people. Mcdonalds firing this 
person over being courteous isn't suprising - but again it's just how a lot 
of these places work - and a lot of these people have no choice but to work 
there because of either lack of money for education or lack of time and 
responsibility to support their families.

Complaining just nets you the same shit responses from people too. It's 
best to just keep your head down, say nothing and do your job. Courtesy, 
compassion, empathy, feelings or any of that shit will end up getting you 
fired eventually. ﻿

made sure the govt left loopholes for those safety nets too. For example, 
let's say you've been with the company for 19 years, you're about to hit 
20, get your retirement, and retire with a comfortable pension. Plus you 
make much more than the other people working there and new hires, but 
you're disabled, so they can't just fired you for no reason, or something 
that can be turned around to "you discriminated against him". So what they 
do is start trumping up other "charges", like falsifying "bad work", then 
claim you're screwing up, slipping up on the job and they've talked to you 
again and again and you just keep "screwing up". They can then fired you 
safely.
But other than that, your job is OPEN SEASON. =( Your boss doesn't like the 
way you sneeze; YOU'RE FIRED!. Your boss hates your handwriting; YOU'RE 
FIRED!! Your boss wants to hire his mistress and get her on the payroll, 
but the only job that gets her around his office regularly is yours; YOU'RE 
FIRED!
Either way, you be the point.. It's stupid.. I hate it.. But not too many 
people seem to care or complain. =(
